It's kinda weird pricing he's gone for honestly. $40 for a signature, $15 more and you get a whole sketch thrown in as well. That's a super low jump compared to a project like Tom's where it was an extra $90 over the hard cover. And Sage only offered 20.
In the first round and only 10 in the second.
Thats a good point. Maybe its the mcdonalds tactic of making your order an expensive product and then making the supersize option really cheap to entice you!
I feel like this "round 2" he shouldve made more expensive

McDonalds in that it's also really inexpensive. He dropped the ball on supply though. It's cool that he's offering it for next to nothing, but my man needs to step up production numbers to take advantage if he's not gonna charge more.
Like, adjust your prices for demand, y'know?
I feel that
Lowering prices is a lot easier than raising prices
Yeah, it might entice some folks with the mentality of "buy while it's low since it's obviously only gonna go up." But it also runs the risk of "scummy dude jacking up the prices because he can."
Yeah its a lot harder for fans to "forgive" raised prices
I could also see fans who get in on it late seeing the inflated price and trying to go to him through email or something to get the original price. Stressful any way that situation would be handled.
